citation.article-title: Five new Legionella species isolated from water.

p.s: Description of Legionella nautarum sp. nov.
Legionella nautarum (nau. tar' um. N.L. gen. n. nautarum, of sailors)
Legionella nautarum is a nonmotile oxidase- and catalase-positive organism.
It exhibits positive reactions in tests for peroxidase, Î²-lactamase, and lipase activities.

It gives negative results in tests for hippurate hydrolysis, elastase production, casein hydrolysis, albumin degradation, chondroitin sulfate degradation, starch hydrolysis, DNase activity, gelatin hydrolysis, protease activity, and browning on agar containing tyrosine, 3,4-diaminobenzoic acid, and 3,5-diaminobenzoic acid.
The type strain is strain 1224 (= ATCC 49506), which has G+C content of 41 mol%.
